meanings.definition: The condition of having multiple sets of chromosomes within a single cell.
meanings.sent1: Polyteny can lead to variations in genetic material within a cell.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study polyteny to understand how cells manage multiple chromosome sets.
meanings.sent3: The cell was so full of chromosomes, it was like a tiny polyteny party!
meanings.sent4: Her cell was a bustling city of chromosomes, a true polyteny metropolis.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the polyteny of the cell was a mesmerizing sight.

meanings.definition: The process of DNA replication resulting in multiple copies of a chromosome being present in a single cell.
meanings.sent1: During polyteny, chromosomes duplicate to create extra copies in the cell.
meanings.sent2: Polyteny is a crucial step in cell division and growth.
meanings.sent3: The DNA party in the cell was in full swing, thanks to polyteny!
meanings.sent4: Polyteny turned the cell into a bustling chromosome factory.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of polyteny lies in the intricate dance of DNA replication.
